title: A Tailored Technology Intervention for Diverse Caregivers of AD Patients
description_brief: The prevalence of family caregivers is projected to increase in concert with the projected increase in number of AD patients. The focus of the study is to gather systematic data on the acceptability and efficacy of a unique technology-based, culturally- tailored psycho-social intervention program that targets ethnically/culturally diverse family caregivers of patients with Alzheimer's Disease. The overall goal of the project is to improve the lives of family caregivers as well as their ability to provide care to their loved one and to reduce disparities in access to needed services and support among caregiver populations.

outcomeMeasures.title: Depression as Measured by Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)
outcomeMeasures.description: CES-D Scale ranges from 0 to 30 with higher scores indicating greater frequency of depressive symptoms.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Follow up visits were not completed for all participants

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver's Self Report of Self-care
outcomeMeasures.description: A 13 Item self care questionnaire is used to measure caregivers self care. Each item can be scored as 0,1,negative 3 or negative 4. The total score ranging from negative 52 to 13. Higher score means better in keeping medical obligations to him/herself.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Follow up visits were not completed for all participants

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver's Self-report of Physical Health
outcomeMeasures.description: SF 12 Health Survey was used to measure physical health of the caregiver. Scores ranges from 0 to 35 with lower score means less limitation to physical health.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Follow up visits were not completed for all participants

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver's Self-efficacy
outcomeMeasures.description: A 15 item Caregiver's self efficacy questionnaire will be used to assess caregiver's self-efficacy. The questionnaire score ranges from 0-1500 percent with a lower percentage score indicating less efficacy.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Follow up visits were not completed for all participants

outcomeMeasures.title: Positive Aspects of Caregiving
outcomeMeasures.description: An 11 item positive aspects of caregiving questionnaire was used to measure positive aspects of caregiving. Each item can be scored 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, negative 3 or negative 4. The total score ranging from negative 44 to 44. Higher score means more positive feelings towards caregiving.

explanation_target: Reason: The described trial is a technology-based, culturally-tailored psycho-social intervention aimed at supporting family caregivers (improving caregiver wellbeing, caregiving skills, and access to services). It does not test a biologic or small-molecule drug, nor does it intervene directly to enhance patient cognition or to treat patients' neuropsychiatric symptoms.

Act: Key extracted details — Title: "A Tailored Technology Intervention for Diverse Caregivers of AD Patients." Intervention: technology-based, culturally-tailored psycho-social program for family caregivers. No drug or placebo is mentioned or implied. I searched for related technology-based caregiver interventions and found multiple examples and reviews of non-pharmacologic digital interventions for caregivers (supporting that this is a behavioral/implementation study rather than a drug trial). citeturn0search1turn0search4turn0search3

Web search results (selected) — included here as supporting evidence that this is a non-drug caregiver intervention: 1) A recent systematic review of digital health interventions supporting family caregivers (summarizes evidence that technology-based caregiver interventions target caregiver outcomes rather than testing drugs). citeturn0search1 2) Feasibility/efficacy pilot of a mobile caregiver intervention (Brain CareNotes / I-CARE) showing technology-delivered caregiver support and outcomes relevant to caregivers. citeturn0search4 3) Pilot study of an evidence-based web-based caregiver skill-building intervention (describes modules and on-demand training for caregivers). citeturn0search3 4) Study of an online intervention (TLC) for caregivers reporting usability and benefit — another example of caregiver-directed digital interventions. citeturn0search0

Reflect: The trial clearly fits a non-therapeutic, caregiver-support category. According to the provided category definitions, it does not meet the criteria for: disease-targeted biologic (no biologic/antibody/vaccine), disease-targeted small molecule (no small-molecule drug), cognitive enhancer (not intended to improve patient cognition directly), or neuropsychiatric symptom improvement (not targeted to treat patients' behavioral/psychiatric symptoms). Therefore the correct classification is 'N/A'.

Notes/ambiguity: No drug name or pharmacologic agent was present in the description or title. If you have the trial registry ID or a full protocol, I can re-check for any pharmacologic components, but based on the provided description and the supporting literature, this should be classified as 'N/A'.
